english: moderation; the mean; impartiality; Confucian text

etymology.description: 中 (center/mean) + 庸 (constant/ordinary) = the constant mean; moderation; title of a Confucian classic.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of centrality with constancy to express balance maintained as a steady norm. In Confucianism it names the Doctrine of the Mean and the ideal of moderation and impartiality.

examples.chinese: 在处理争端时(在處理爭端時)，他坚持中庸之道(他堅持中庸之道)。
examples.pinyin: Zài chǔlǐ zhēngduān shí, tā jiānchí zhōngyōng zhī dào.
examples.english: When handling disputes, he adheres to the Doctrine of the Mean.

examples.chinese: 我最近在研读《中庸》(我最近在研讀《中庸》)。
examples.english: I have been studying the Doctrine of the Mean recently.

examples.chinese: 领导风格要避免极端(領導風格要避免極端)，追求中庸而不平庸(追求中庸而不平庸)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐngdǎo fēnggé yào bìmiǎn jíduān, zhuīqiú zhōngyōng ér bù píngyōng.
examples.english: A leadership style should avoid extremes, seeking moderation without mediocrity.
